Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Total Neoadjuvant Therapy with Chemoimmunotherapy in High-Risk pMMR Rectal Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: This single-arm phase 2 trial was conducted at the Gastrointestinal Cancer Center, Peking University Cancer Hospital & Institute, from June 2020 to October 2021.

Participants.evidence: Participants were patients with high-risk pMMR rectal cancer.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention included 3 cycles of induction oxaliplatin and capecitabine combined with camrelizumab, followed by radiotherapy (50.6 Gy in 22 fractions) with concurrent capecitabine.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the pathologic complete response rate, measured at the end of treatment.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding details were not applicable as this was a single-arm study.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding details were not applicable as this was a single-arm study.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 25 patients enrolled (19 men, 6 women; median age 58 years), 22 completed the TNT schedule.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The pathologic complete response rate was 33.3% (7/21).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The pathologic complete response rate was 33.3% (7/21).

Harms.evidence: The most common adverse event was nausea (80%); grade 3 toxic effects occurred in 36% of patients.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.
